div1.p: Rose reports that Flexner wants the title of the best study on yellow fever epidemiology.

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, February 28, 1919
div1.opener:
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
-----
WICKLIFFE ROSE
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M. D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M. D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. M. HOWARD, M. D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
ERNST C. MEYER, PH. D.
DIRECTOR OF
SURVEYS AND EXHIBITS
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
February 28, 1919.
MEMBERS
-----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
HERMAN M. RIGGS
WALLACE BUTTRICE
SIMON FLEXNER
FREDERICK T. GATES
WILLIAM C. GORGAS
STARR J. MURPHY
WALTER M. PAGE
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
WILLIAM H. WELCH
-----
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
In a letter just received from Dr.
Simon Flexner he asks: “What is the best book
on yellow fever with especial reference to the
epidemiology?” I should welcome your advice
on this question.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Dr. Henry R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
